abstracts.cdata!:
The Third Education Project in Liberia
            was achieved. The Bank played an important role in the
            implementation of this project. The principal lessons
            learned from implementation of this project are summarized
            below under three headings: (a) centralized workshops, (b)
            technical assistance, and (c) quality of local leadership. A
            thorough assessment of proposed changes, including a review
            of alternative strategies for attaining them is a
            prerequisite for bringing about change and reform. The
            effectiveness of the technical team was affected, partly by
            a drastic modification of its composition, early arrival of
            the experts and poor utilization of fellowships. Fellowships
            in certain areas, such as agricultural education, could not
            be awarded, because of a paucity of qualified candidates.
            The quality of local leadership is the key element in
            bringing about institutional development. The Bank's
            input, in terms of software, was extremely limited. The
            provision of an expert was deleted, and the fellowships were
            modified to comprise short study tours. Yet, the Forestry
            Training Institute (FTI) has been able to establish itself
            as an outstanding training institution, partly because of
            the high quality of leadership exercised by its faculty. The
            right choices of faculty members were critical factors in
            bringing about changes.

docna.cdata!:
Liberia - Third Education Project : Loan
            1417 - Loan Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Liberia - Third Education Project
            : Loan 1417 - Loan Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed project comprises: (a)
            strengthening the industrial training system, including
            construction, furnishing and equipping of buildings for an
            agricultural and industrial training board and a vocational
            training center; (b) strengthening forestry training,
            including construction, furnishing and equipping of a
            training institute for forest rangers and forest workers;
            and (c) improving secondary education, particularly in
            science and technology, including construction, furnishing
            and equipping of 4 science and technology centers at rural
            secondary schools, and vehicles to transport children from
            outlying schools to two of these centers; and (d)
            strengthening the Division of Educational Facilities in the
            Ministry of Education by providing equipment, vehicles, 2
            man-years of technical assistance and 7 man-years of fellowships.
